definition: To forcefully expel saliva or other substances from the mouth, often as a sign of disrespect or contempt. This action is commonly observed during confrontations or as a gesture of disdain.

examples.german: Der Fußballspieler spuckte seinen Gegner an.
examples.english: The soccer player spat on his opponent.

examples.german: Das Baby spuckte die Milch wieder aus.
examples.english: The baby spat out the milk.

examples.german: Er spuckte in seine Hände, um sie zu befeuchten.
examples.english: He spat into his hands to moisten them.
